Connect to a WiFi network with Arduino on ESP32-C3

dev board ESP32-C3-DevKitM-1
chip ESP32-C3-MINI-1-N4
features wifi connect ssid esp32c3

Before starting

Dependancies

Ensure the following dependancies are downloaded and available:
  • ESP32 Arduino
  • CP210x USB to UART Bridge VCP Drivers

Pre-requisites

Try these simpler or similar examples:
  1. Hello world ESP32-C3
  2. Scan WiFi with Arduino on ESP32-C3

Buy the components

  1. ESP32-C3-DevKitM-1

Code

Download code connect-wifi-arduino-esp32c3.ino

Makefile

Prototype

A photo of the actual setup.

Arduino IDE settings

Ensure the following IDE settings before flashing.

Serial console

Serial output from the firmware.

Description

Create a file Secret.h in the same folder with the code.

$ tree
.
├── Secret.h
└── connect-wifi-arduino-esp32c3.ino

Include the actual Wifi SSID name and password in the file.

char ssid[] = "secret";
char pass[] = "secret";

Compile and upload the firmware to connect to the WiFi.
